citeinfo.origin: Hennepin County Department of Environmental Services & Minnesota DNR - MIS Bureau
citeinfo.title: Land Cover - Minnesota Land Cover Classification System

descript.abstract: Land cover data set based on the Minnesota Land Cover Classification System (MLCCS) coding scheme. This data was produced using a combination of aerial photograph interpretation and field surveys. There is a minimum mapping unit of 1 acre for natural vegetation and 2 acres for artificial cover types.
descript.purpose: To support conservation activities, land use planning, and analysis

idinfo.accconst: land cover, vegetation, cultivated land, impervious surface, natural plant communities, biota
idinfo.useconst: land cover, vegetation, cultivated land, impervious surface, natural plant communities, biota
idinfo.datacred: Hennepin County Department of Environmental Services. Funding provided by various municipalities, Minnesota Department of Natural Resources, Mississippi Watershed Management Organization, Legislative-Citizen Commission on Minnesota Resources (LCCMR).
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; Esri ArcGIS 10.2.2.3552

dataqual.complete: The data is typically created by cities and counties as funding becomes available. Consequently, this is not a seamless dataset and is sparse outside of the metropolitan region.

horizpa.horizpar: All digitizing was done at 1:3,000 scale on digital ortho photographs, with a horizontal interpretation and digitizing accuracy of 10 meters.

procstep.procdesc: Attribute Lineage: Not specifically assessed. Cartographic Lineage: MLCCS Areas: Several sources were used for land cover interpretation: ortho rectified aerial photography (USGS, FSA, county images, etc.), U.S. Fish & Wildlife Service National Wetland Inventory, MCBS natural communities, soil maps, and field surveys. Land cover types were delineated on hard copy print outs at 1:3,000 of DOQs with NWI and MCBS polygons. Color infrared photographs and field surveys were used to identify natural vegetation cover types. Artificial surfaces and cultivated areas were interpreted from the aerial photographs. When time, budget, and access allowed, the natural community types were field checked. Horizontal accuracy is 10 meters or less, which corresponds to 30'' on the ground. The polygons were digitized on screen using the DOQs as the back coverage.e.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Area of feature in internal units squared.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

overview.eadetcit: UNIQUE_ID 25 16,CHAR A unique number assigned to each polygon to help track it for field checking. The DNR assigns the numbers based on the USGS DOQ quarter-quad number and a print tiling scheme. C_NUM 42 5,Integer Number MLCCS Level 4 Land Cover Type - Number Code C_ALPHA 47 16,Text MLCCS Level 4 Land Cover Type - Alpha Code C_TEXT 65 140,Text Full text description of the classification code FLD_CODE 165 5,Integer Number Land cover code derived from field work. FLD_DATE 200 8,Text Date of the field work (year-month-day with no delimiters, e.g. 20030719) FLD_LEVEL 201 4,Integer Number The degree the polygon was field checked. Mandatory if FLD_CODE is populated. 0 = site not visited, 1 = viewed the site from a distance, 2 = visited the edge of the site, 3 = visited part of the site, 4 = visited the entire site 0 site not visited 1 viewed the site from a distance 2 visited the edge of the site 3 visited part of the site 4 visited the entire site IMG_CODE 205 5,Integer Number Land cover code derived from aerial pohto or image interpretation. IMG_TYPE 210 250,Text List of date and type of images, e.g. [2003 FSA color DOQ | 2000 Met Council BW DOQ] M_0XX 235 3,INT Modifiers to indicate percent imperviousness 0 0% impervious 100 100% impervious 12 12% impervious ( 2 acre lot) 20 20% impervious ( 1 acre lot) 25 25% impervious (1/2 acre lot) 30 30% impervious (1/3 acre lot) 38 38% impervious (1/4 acre lot) 65 65% impervious (1/8 acre lot) 72 72% impervious (large buildings) 85 85% impervious (large buildings or pavement) 96 96% impervious M_2XX 238 3,INT Modifiers to identify Land Use 210 Residential 211 Low Density Residential (one dwelling unit per acre) 212 Medium Density Residential (two to five dwelling units per acre) 213 High Density Residential (greater than five dwelling units per acre) 220 Commercial / Industrial 221 Commercial 222 Industrial 223 City Center 224 Institutional 225 Corporate Park 226 Recreational 227 Utility 228 Brown field 229 Other 230 Transportation (Roads & Railroads) 231 Roads 232 Railroads 233 Parking Lot 234 Runway 235 Marina / Barge Tie-ups 236 Other 240 Open space use 241 Parks (picnic grounds, ball fields, playgrounds) 242 Golf Course 243 Big Lawn 244 Public Garden 245 Cemetery 250 Pavement 251 Unimproved (Dirt) 252 Gravel 253 Bituminous 254 Concrete 255 Porous Pavement 256 Brick / Cobblestone 257 Other 260 Farm buildings 261 Farmstead 262 Feeding Operation 270 Agricultural field methods 271 Straight row 272 Crop residue 273 Contoured 274 Terraced 275 Pasture 276 Hayfield M_30X 241 16,Text Modifiers for vegetation management M_31X 244 25,Text Modifiers for management type M_32X 247 50,Text Modifiers for natural community disturbance types M_34X 250 2,Text Modifiers for the quality of the natural community, based on DNR's Natural Heritage Element Occurrence Rank (EOR). Valid values are: A = highest quality natural community, B = good quality natural community, C = moderate condition natural community, D = poor condition of a natural community, NA = Native species present in an altered/non-native plant community, NN = Altered / non-native plant community FLD_LEVEL must be => 3 for a A or B ranking; FLD_LEVEL must be => 2 for a C or D ranking; FLD_LEVEL must be => 1 for a NA or NN ranking A highest quality natural community B good quality natural community C moderate condition natural community D poor condition of a natural community NA Native species present in an altered/non-native plant community NN Altered / non-native plant community M_400 253 3,INT Overgrown prairie/savanna 400 Overgrown prairie/savanna M_401 256 3,INT Overgrown woodland 401
